main event: Two pilots from Langley AFB observed a white or grayish-white light, stationary or moving at a low rate of speed, about 5 to 10 degrees above the horizon for about 10 minutes.
interesting points: The object was visible for about 10 minutes and was observed by two pilots from Langley AFB.
No conclusions could be drawn as to the nature of the object.
Ground-based observations were also made by the Langley AFB control tower and GCA units.
The report mentions that a rocket or missile fired from Wallops NASA Station could not be revealed and was out of range of normal radar.
There were no photographs or physical evidence associated with this sighting.
location: 12 miles south of Langley AFB, Virginia
witnesses: two pilots from Langley AFB, control tower and GCA operators
